key_changes: Updated transition property from 'transform 150ms ease-out' to 'all 200ms ease-out'
Enhanced hover state with scale(1.05) transform
Added active state with scale(0.98) transform for tactile feedback
file_insights.impact: UI/UX enhancement affecting Avatar component interactivity and visual feedback

patterns_discovered.description: Adding multi-state animations (hover and active) to UI components for improved user feedback
patterns_discovered.context: Avatar component receives both hover (scale up) and active (scale down) states

patterns_discovered.description: Changing from specific property transitions ('transform') to broader transitions ('all') to accommodate multiple animated properties
patterns_discovered.context: Allows smooth animation of cursor change alongside transform

patterns_discovered.description: Using scale transform on active state to provide visual press-down effect
patterns_discovered.context: scale(0.98) on active creates illusion of button press without size changes

gotchas_discovered.description: Transition duration increased from 150ms to 200ms, which may affect perceived responsiveness
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: 200ms is still within acceptable range for micro-interactions (typically 100-300ms)

gotchas_discovered.description: Changing from 'transform' to 'all' could animate unintended properties if added to selector later
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Should monitor for style additions that might be unintentionally animated

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully implemented hover scale interaction to Avatar component with additional active state feedback
approach_outcome.execution_efficiency: Direct implementation completed on first attempt
approach_outcome.completeness: All requirements met - component now has visual feedback on hover and active states

recommendations.suggestion: Audit other interactive UI components (Button, IconButton, etc.) to ensure consistent micro-interaction patterns across the design system
Consider using 'transform' transition instead of 'all' to optimize animation performance by excluding non-transform properties
Verify that @media (prefers-reduced-motion) is respected; consider adding motion preference detection if not present
